products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate
products.label: Cloud automation for watsonx Orchestrate
products.short_description: Creates and configures an instance of IBM watsonx Orchestrate
products.long_description:
[IBM watsonx Orchestrate](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/current?topic=getting-started-watsonx-orchestrate) puts AI to work, helping you build, deploy, and manage powerful AI assistants and agents that automate workflows and processes with generative AI. In addition to watsonx Orchestrate, this deployable architecture includes optional tools for key encryption and observability, giving you everything that you need to manage your watsonx Orchestrate deployment. 

Leverage [Terraform IBM Modules](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules) to shape and scale your solutions. You can integrate Terraform IBM Modules (TIM) to extend functionality and design a solution tailored to your environment and operations needs. These modules offer reusable, customizable elements that follow IBM Cloud's recommended practices. You can access the [source code and documentation](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate) and use it to extend your current architecture or create new solutions.

features.title: watsonx Orchestrate instance
features.description: Provision and configure an instance of IBM watsonx Orchestrate. [Learn more](https://www.ibm.com/products/watsonx-orchestrate).

features.title: Sets up logging for the watsonx Orchestrate instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Cloud Logs to route, alert, and visualize platform logs that are generated by your watsonx Orchestrate instance. [Learn more](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=phone-troubleshooting-logs#phone-troubleshooting-logs)

features.title: Sets up monitoring operational metrics for the watsonx Orchestrate instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Cloud Monitoring to measure how users and applications interact with your watsonx Orchestrate instance.

features.title: Sets up activity tracking for the watsonx Orchestrate instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Activity Tracker Event Routing to route and securely store auditing events that are related to your watsonx Orchestrate instance. [Learn more](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=cloud-activity-tracking-events-watsonx-orchestrate)

features.title: Composable and Extensible Architecture
features.description: This architecture illustrates how Terraform IBM Modules(TIM) can be integrated to deliver a complete solution on IBM Cloud. Each module is a reusable, and validated component for security, compliance, and operational IBM best practices. You can deploy this architecture as-is or configure it as code by leveraging the underlying modules to fit your specific requirements. Explore the [source code and documentation](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate) to adapt, extend, or create entirely new solutions using these building blocks.

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, support is handled through the [original repo](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate). If you experience issues kindly open an issue [here](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-orchestrate/issues). Please note that this product is not currently supported through the IBM Cloud Support Center.

diagrams.description: This deployable architecture provisions a watsonx Orchestrate instance on IBM Cloud. After the instance is created, you receive a link to a dashboard that provides direct access to your watsonx Orchestrate environment. Optionally, you can also configure observability services, which includes IBM Cloud Activity Tracker Event Routing to monitor how users and applications interact with watsonx Orchestrate, supporting compliance and auditability. Enable IBM Cloud Logs to collect, view, and analyze platform logs related to watsonx Orchestrate to gain visibility into usage patterns through active tasks and queries. While IBM Cloud Monitoring captures essential metrics such as CPU and memory usage, helping you proactively monitor system performance and resource consumption.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance is configured to collect platform metrics from the specified region. You can configure only one instance of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance is already configured. You might not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).
